intro: Tylophora sublanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-lanceleaf tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in forested areas and can thrive in both moist and dry conditions. Tylophora sublanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
